{{infobox character | people=[[Dwarves|Dwarf]] | name=Khîm | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[House of Ransom]] | affiliation= | language=[[Khuzdul]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{FA|486}} | deathlocation=[[House of Ransom]] | age= | notablefor= | house=[[Petty-dwarves]] | parentage=[[Mîm]] | siblings=[[Ibun]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Khîm''' was the son of [[Mîm]] and brother of [[Ibun]], who were the last of the [[Petty-dwarves]] to survive in [[Middle-earth]].{{CH|7}}, p. 131 ==History== One day, when out travelling with his father and brother, the three were set upon by [[Túrin|Túrin Turambar]]'s [[Gaurwaith|outlaw band]]. With Ibun, Khîm fled into the mist, but a stray arrow fired by one of the outlaws struck him as he fled. Though he escaped back to Mîm's halls beneath [[Amon Rûdh]]—no doubt with his brother's help—his wound was mortal, and he died before his father returned. Túrin and his companions came to dwell in Mîm's house, which became known as the [[House of Ransom]], in part because of Khîm's premature death. The archer who shot him, an outlaw named [[Andróg]], was cursed by Mîm, and forced to break his bow.{{CH|7}}, p. 132 ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | MIM | | |MIM=[[Mîm]]
